instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message:
Board works fine with WiFi cable unplugged (from J3501), and also works fine when WiFi cable is connected IF <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> is removed. Everything else works well, no issues in ASD. Replaced with known-good <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> (before I realized that ANY <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> being in place caused it to turn off), and no dice. No liquid damage, board simply began powering off during boot-up one day (according to previous tech notes).

Thanks in advance for any assistance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message:
Uhm, is this the same board? 
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/6993-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-powers-off-as-soon-as-j3501-cable-is-connected[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: Nope. I actually saw that thread, which prompted me to remove <CHIP>U3540</CHIP>, but that thread had no resolution, so...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: You did try with another cable and card?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: Yes, correct. I tested the board in all 3 of my "known-good" test assembly housings.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: Does APT work when you go into the boot menu when holding ALT key?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: It doesn't make it that far if I have APT plugged in, unfortunately. Cuts off before the boot menu loads.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: I have no idea. <TRANSISTOR>Q3550</TRANSISTOR> maybe, just guessing at this point....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message:
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q3550</TRANSISTOR> with no change.

Bumping, hoping maybe Louis has any other suggestions? I can't find anything amiss in my measurements or testing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: Remove <RESISTOR>R3500</RESISTOR>/1/2 and see if it stays on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: Hey Duke, thanks. I removed <RESISTOR>R3500</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R3501</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R3502</RESISTOR> and the board still powers off, unfortunately.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: Try another BIOS to be sure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: Thanks Duke. Tried another BIOS (file and different chip), and same issue. Could this be a PCH issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: It really doesn't leave much else. I don't see how it can shut down the system through the PCI-E lines though....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message:
Yeah, I'm out of ideas. I even replaced the connector just now to be absolutely sure it wasn't causing issues. No change. Does the fact that the board works fine with <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> removed just mean that it's definitely the power for APT that's causing the issue?

I might abandon this one. If anyone can solve it, I'll pay you $30.00 through PayPal. ;)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers off when J3501 connected.
threads.message: I'm out of ideas for this one as well. You could try and replace the caps/coils in the data/clock lines as a last resort.
